some real stupid haters here. The minus button is supposed to be for faulty or mis-represented torrents

@bender1110: I know what you meant, but that's watered-down reality. Facts are, well, different and sobering:
1) Two guys are convinced that majority of my torrents are, as you've said, "mis-represented".
2) One guy simply hate my flag. I know from where he comes, so, it doesn't bother nor surprise me.
3) Bunch of payed shills quite regularly visit TPB (other public torrent sites too) and to make torrents repulsive - rate them down or scream FAKE! just to divert people from download. 
4) Two uploaders/affiliates probably out of old-fashioned jealousy rate down all my torrents.
5) One staff member does that too, but he stopped or haven't be caught lately - yet

Resolving that issue is quite simple; TPB M.U.S.T remove "Quality" rating option. It acts counterproductive and serves as playground for lunatics. If somebody want to leave comment, procedure is a tad longer and little more complicated and these idiots cannot articulate their thoughts anyhow, hitting the "minus" is only thing they are capable of.

... also, script for bot activities is so simpler in cases when some moron just want to press one button on page just once. It is one-liner, idiotically simple, and script log-in, press button and change proxy server (what they use almost always)... completely automatically - and that could be done every few minutes. It's has been used intensively in cases of on-line voting or rating anywhere, from Idol-voting to making fake pools, for years.

ERR.

twentyforty: Agree with all the other sensibel people here, it's a great torrent!

On the question of changes to make piratebay equally as sensibel: There is MORE to that elevated statement piratebay keeps issue towards the movie/music industri (SOPA etc), that "we must be free" (in a sence). But does piratebay really mean that? No of course not!

On every other file sharing site they present you with links to "their friends", sites that do the same as themselves. Does piratebay do this? No, and they actually seem panicly afraid the users (us) will post links outside of piratebay to sites with similar services. This way they keep the "customers" who generates revenue (when clicking on ad-banners etc).

Related to that; ask yourself why you can't change or delete your uploaded torrents posts? Well, the more torrents in the system, the more piratebay sell ads: When marketing they of course includes ALL torrents, even those totally inactive ("Look how many torrents we have, thus extremely many visitors").

So, there is so much more to piratebay than you'd thought...

One other thing: The administrators are probably told to act in a certain way, to keep visitor statistics (making a LOT of money). Administrators that are easy to lead, most likely really young and aggressive boys (many of you probably met these boys in the forum, they tend to threat and be really obnoxious).

Me? Well I still return to parentbay (sorry...piratebay) when in dispair, but I do my most downloading using Mipony (or Jdownloader) after visiting for instance: THEPARADOXusabitTRUHDonedll and so on. Preferably via rappichair links (can't spell other sites here, your comment become unpostable...). I get sick speeds! :-)  And without paying a dime.

Even THIS release of Little White Lies is available on ONEDLLandPARADOX..! :-)
